isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - SLEEPER CAB REAR CAB AIR SUSPENSION system

svcproc.title: SLEEPER CAB REAR CAB AIR SUSPENSION system

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para:
Refer to Figure 102
for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system contains one air spring (bag) strut module (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly (Figure 102)
needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 4), fitting (Item 5), tee fitting (Item 6), air spring strut module (Item 2), height control valve (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 3), air spring strut module (Item 2) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcprocinfo.para:

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve ON Sleeper Cab

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 3, Figure 102) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 103
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release collet (Item 1) in against height control valve body and pull air line (supply) (Item 3) from height control valve fitting in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 4).

Press and hold release collet (Item 1) in against tee fitting (Item 2) body and pull air line (susp) (Item 5) to passenger side air spring strut module from tee fitting in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 4).

Press and hold release collet (Item 1) in against tee fitting (Item 2) body and pull air line (susp) (Item 5) to driver side air spring strut module from tee fitting in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 4).
Remove hex head link bolt, washer and hex nut (Item 10) from height control valve linkage (Item 6) and height control valve arm (Item 9).
Remove two hex head bolts, washers and hex lock nuts (Items 10) and remove height control valve (Item 4) from height control valve mounting bracket (Item 14).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring Strut Module on Sleeper Cab

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 102
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove driver side air spring strut module (Item 2) as follows.

step2.para: Press and hold release collet (Item 13) in against fitting (Item 5) body and pull air line (susp) (Item 4) from driver side air spring strut module (Item 2).
Remove two hex flanged head bolts (Item 16 and hex flanged nuts (Items 17) from strut adjust support (Item 11) at the frame rail and remove cab strut strap assembly (Item 12).
Remove four hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged nuts (Items 14 and 15) from strut adjust support (Item 11) at the frame rail.

Remove four hex flanged nuts (Item 19) from cab mounting plate (Item 1) threaded studs (Item 9) under top plate of driver side air spring strut module (Item 2) and remove air spring strut module and cab strut strap assembly (Item 12).
